meanings.definition: The act of breaking something down into smaller parts or components.
meanings.sent1: The disaggregation of the puzzle pieces made it easier to solve.
meanings.sent2: The disaggregation of the recipe into steps helped me understand it better.
meanings.sent3: The disaggregation of the team into smaller groups led to a fun competition.
meanings.sent4: The disaggregation of the problem revealed its complex nature.
meanings.sent5: The disaggregation of the colors made the painting more vibrant.

meanings.definition: The process of separating data into its individual components.
meanings.sent1: The disaggregation of the spreadsheet allowed us to analyze each data point.
meanings.sent2: The disaggregation of the report highlighted specific trends in the data.
meanings.sent3: The disaggregation of the numbers made the math class more interesting.
meanings.sent4: The disaggregation of the information revealed hidden patterns.
meanings.sent5: The disaggregation of the code exposed errors in the program.

meanings.definition: The distribution of a larger entity into smaller units.
meanings.sent1: The disaggregation of the company into branches improved efficiency.
meanings.sent2: The disaggregation of the project into tasks made it more manageable.
meanings.sent3: The disaggregation of the cake into slices made sharing easier.
meanings.sent4: The disaggregation of power led to a more balanced system.
meanings.sent5: The disaggregation of the team into roles enhanced collaboration.
